title: Creating a Common Denominator
text: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of $$x+3$$ and $$(x-2)$$ is $$\left(x+3\right) \left(x-2\right)$$
speech: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of  x plus 3  and , parentheses x minus 2,   is  parentheses x plus 3,  times, parentheses x minus 2,
pacedSpeech: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of   x plus 3
is    x plus 3,  times,  x minus 2,

title: Rewriting Each Fraction
text: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get $$\frac{2\left(x+3\right)}{\left(x-2\right) \left(x+3\right)}+\frac{5\left(x-2\right)}{\left(x-2\right) \left(x+3\right)}$$
speech: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get  fraction, 2 times, parentheses x plus 3, , over, parentheses x minus 2,  times, parentheses x plus 3, ,  plus fraction, 5 times, parentheses x minus 2, , over, parentheses x minus 2,  times, parentheses x plus 3, ,
pacedSpeech: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get  this expression

title: Adding the Fractions
speech: Adding the fractions, we get  fraction, 2 times, parentheses x plus 3,  plus, 5 times, parentheses x minus 2, , over, parentheses x minus 2,  times, parentheses x plus 3, ,
pacedSpeech: Adding the fractions, we get   fraction, 2 times,  x plus 3,  plus, 5 times,  x minus 2, , over,  x minus 2,  times,  x plus 3, ,
